page.title: 11TRANSPORT IN SHROTON
page.content: TRANSPORT OF SOME KIND IS ESSENTIAL FOR THE PEOPLE OF SHROTON AS THERE ARE ONLY TWO VERY SMALL SHOPS WHICH STOCK ONLY ESSENTIAL THINGS. THERE IS A REGULAR{BUS}SERVICE EVERY TWO HOURS GOING TO SHAFTESBURY OR BLANDFORD, THE TWO NEIGHBOURING TOWNS WHICH ARE ABOUT SEVEN MILES EACH WAY FROM SHROTON. THIS BUS SERVICE IS USED ALSO FOR TAKING CHILDREN TO THE SECONDARY SCHOOL IN SHAFTESBURY AND THE PRIMARY SCHOOL IN FONTMELL MAGNA. MOST OF THE SHROTON RESIDENTS HAVE AT LEAST ONE OR MORE{CARS.}THESE CARS ARE USED FOR TRAVELLING TO WORK AND FOR DRIVING TO TOWNS TO GET SHOPPING. VERY FEW PEOPLE USE A BICYCLE OR MOTORCYCLE AS THEIR MAIN FORM OF TRANSPORT. THERE IS A{RAILWAY}STATION ABOUT 12 MILES AWAY ON THE WATERLOO-EXETER LINE WHICH IS USEFUL FOR PEOPLE WANTING TO COMMUTE OR GO SHOPPING IN BIGGER TOWNS
